title: Socio-Emotional Competency and Professional Language Communication Skill Development Course to Enhance Employability of Engineering Graduates

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational engineering knowledge, understanding of educational settings, and comprehension of basic job-related vocabulary (technical terms) and grammatical structures (official document formatting rules).
context.additional_context: Employment competency enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers, combining engineering literacy and socio-emotional skills. Focuses on improving technical document interpretation (manuals/reports), presentations (visual aids), and verbal expression in interviews (clear pronunciation, specialized vocabulary usage)

learning_goals: Analyze trends and requirements in the engineering job market, improve technical writing skills by drafting a self-analysis report (in technical document format), and enhance oral presentation (presentation) abilities.

Perform collaboration simulations based on social-emotional competencies (self-awareness, self-regulation, empathy, interpersonal skills), acquire effective communication techniques (active listening, persuasive expression) for evaluation and feedback incorporation.

Learners identify three career challenges related to technological changes or lifelong learning needs, create a personalized competency development plan (5+ items) based on SMART principles, and achieve 80% or higher feedback satisfaction from advisors. Additionally, strengthen logical expression skills (structured sentence composition) and professional terminology usage (engineering/employment fields) during the planning process.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
